question: All animals belonging to various phyla are assigned to which highest category in the classification system?
The Kingdom Plantae comprises all:
The two groups referred to in the classification system are:
Taxonomic categories from species to kingdom are shown in ascending order in:
Sub-categories in the taxonomic hierarchy have been developed to:
options: Facilitate more sound and scientific placement of various taxa
answer: Facilitate more sound and scientific placement of various taxa

question: As we go higher from species to kingdom, the number of common characteristics:
Lower the taxa, more are the characteristics that the members within the taxon:
Higher the category, greater is the difficulty of:
options: Determining the relationship to other taxa at the same level
answer: Determining the relationship to other taxa at the same level

question: The problem of classification becomes more complex when:
Table 1.1 indicates the taxonomic categories of which common organisms?
What is the genus of Homo sapiens?
To which family does man belong?
In which order is man classified?
What is the phylum of man?
What is the genus of housefly?
To which class does the housefly belong?
Housefly belongs to which phylum?
What is the family of mango?
To which division does mango belong?
What is the order of wheat?
Wheat belongs to which family?
Which class does wheat belong to?
